content:
Public stream created by Timmy Silesmo. Description:

C#/.net WebAssembly toolchain

This is good, one of the things we should discuss is where to host issues and discussions that we want to record. There is an issue I created at https://github.com/dotnet/runtimelab/issues/2409 to canvas the runtime team's opinion. However it is largely up to us, I was just exploring options. In general it seems that issues should live with the code so if we carry on with Rust then we could ask for somewhere in BA, however if we move quickly to c# then a new project under dotnet/runtime would be better. At least that is how I am seeing it currently, but happy to go with the consensus.

NativeAOT-LLVM: Question: Does dotnet/runtimelab want to host WIT code gen issues 路 Issue #2409 路 dotnet/runtimelab
Hi, I started a discussion on https://bytecodealliance.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/394175-SIG-Guest-Languages about where to host a place where the interested parties can discuss the way forward f...
